body: I think this just means that it's using both stdio & the tcp/ip socket. It doesn't seem to be a recent change anyway. Is it causing any issues?

I am using port 8080 to serve another daemon. Until I upgraded to 1.61.0 everything worked fine. Since that upgrade I am getting a fatal error on `rclone serve restic --stdio --b2-hard-delete`, because port 8080 is already in use. Reading the documentation, that seems surprising because `--stdio` should not require port 8080 to be available.
For people who read the docs and have at least passing experience with these things, using `--addr` or the `RCLONE_ADDR` environment variable is an easy fix. For others it might not be that obvious how to fix this.
Got it. Can you try an older version of rclone too just to be sure if this is a regression or an older bug?

It looks like a regression to me. Here is the same command in 1.60.1:
```

[0:06] 100.00%  17 / 17 snapshots

read 1048576 bytes of data packs
[0:00] 100.00%  1 / 1 packs

no errors were found
rclone: 2022/12/21 18:57:31 DEBUG : jottacloud root '<redacted>': DELETE /locks/edde56a08ff0a35e56fa30f325436e34dd770b7764a7eaefc73cfb621edb4924
```

It looks a bit different, but does not mention serving via `http://127.0.0.1:8080/` anywhere.

Ah, yes, I see the regression in the code now.

Once [fix-6644-serve-restic](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6644-serve-restic?rgh-link-date=2022-12-21T12%3A35%3A40Z) is merged, it should be fixed.

I think this should fix the problem @ElRico - can you give it a test please

[v1.62.0-beta.6660.8863fb491.fix-6644-serve-restic](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6644-serve-restic/v1.62.0-beta.6660.8863fb491.fix-6644-serve-restic/) on branch [fix-6644-serve-restic](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6644-serve-restic) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

issue.title: restic cannot connect via tcp/ip unless --stdio option is provided for rclone serve restic

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put into solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

https://forum.rclone.org/t/rclone-v1-61-0-release/34914/3?u=el_rico

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

restic cannot connect to rclone via tcp/ip, unless the `--stdio` option is provided for the `rclone serve restic` command.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.61.0
- os/version: debian 11.6 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.10.0-20-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.4
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

debian 11.6 (64 bit)

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Jottacloud

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
restic stats --verbose -o rclone.args="serve restic --stdio --addr ':9999' --b2-hard-delete -vv"
echo "-------"
restic stats --verbose -o rclone.args="serve restic --addr ':9999' --b2-hard-delete -vv"
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.61.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "serve" "restic" "--stdio" "--addr" ":9999" "--b2-hard-delete" "-vv" "<redacted>"]
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "<redacted>"
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 DEBUG : Using config file from "<redacted>"
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 NOTICE: jottacloud root '<redacted>': Serving restic REST API on [http://[::]:9999/]
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 DEBUG : file-5577006791947779410: GET request error: object not found
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:30 DEBUG : keys: list request
repository 46963384 opened (repository version 1) successfully, password is correct
<snip>
-------
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:31 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.61.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "serve" "restic" "--addr" ":9999" "--b2-hard-delete" "-vv" "<redacted>"]
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:31 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "<redacted>"
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:31 DEBUG : Using config file from "<redacted>"
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:32 NOTICE: jottacloud root '<redacted>': Serving restic REST API on [http://[::]:9999/]
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:32 INFO  : 
rclone: Transferred:              0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
rclone: Elapsed time:         0.4s
rclone: 
rclone: 2022/12/21 16:04:32 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
Fatal: unable to open repository at rclone:jottacloud:<redacted>: error talking HTTP to rclone: Get "http://localhost/file-5577006791947779410": unexpected EOF
```

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body: This fix has been released in v1.61.1 which is available now
This is just to confirm that 1.61.1 does indeed fix the issue on my system. Thank you for the fix @ncw!
